Element.Name: UBL VersionID
Element.Description: Identifies the UBL version on which the transaction instance is based.

Element.Name: Customization identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Profile identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears.

Element.Name: Catalogue identifier
Element.Description: An catalogue instance must contain an identifier. The identifier enables positive referencing the document instance for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Catalogue action code
Element.Description: Identifies how a received catalogue should be used against existing catalogue lines sent in previous catalogues, so that no discrepancies occur between the suppliers and customers information. Describes how to treat existing items, not part of the received catalogue and those that are included (unchanged, changed or deleted). Default action is to fully replace the source catalogue. Legal values: Add, Update, Delete, Replace Add = New catalogue with all catalogue lines shall be established. If the catalogue allready exists, it must be rejected by the recipients system. Update=Update lines of an existing catalogue. Replace = Replacing the entire catalogue. Delete = Delete the entire catalogue

Element.Name: Catalogue name
Element.Description: A name of the catalogue for general reference. E.g. "Christmas catalogue"

Element.Name: Catalogue issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the catalogue instance was issued. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Catalogue version
Element.Description: The version of the catalogue revision. The version ID is used to control how a Catalogue transaction acts on existing lines that are not stated in the transactions. Should they be left alone or deleted. If Catalogue transaction is "Replace" then action codes on the line have no relevance. All existing lines are deleted and the ones stated in the Catalogue transaction added. If Catalogue transaction is „Update“ then action codes on lines control each line.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Reference identifier
Element.Description: Positive identification of the reference such as a unique identifier.

Element.Name: Contract IssueDate
Element.Description: Date of referenced contract.

Element.Name: Reference type
Element.Description: The short description of what is reference such as contract type, document type , meter etc.

Element.Name: Source catalogue identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the existing, already received catalogue that this message should be acted upon, so that no discrepancies occur between the suppliers and customers information.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the providing party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message. Organization number for norwegian parties

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Ise in the absence of or in addition to Party identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Element.Name: Registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the provider is legally registered

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: The supplying organisations legal organisation number. For norwegian suppliers: Attributes: schemeID="NO:ORGNR", schemeName="Foretaksregisteret" for companies AS, ASA and NUF, but is recommended for all companies registered in "Foretaksregisteret". schemeAgencyID="82"

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city where the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country in which the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message. Organization number for norwegian parties

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Ise in the absence of or in addition to Party identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Element.Name: Registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the provider is legally registered

Element.Name: Company ID
Element.Description: The supplying organisations legal organisation number. For norwegian suppliers: Attributes: schemeID="NO:ORGNR", schemeName="Foretaksregisteret" for companies AS, ASA and NUF, but is recommended for all companies registered in "Foretaksregisteret". schemeAgencyID="82"

Element.Name: City name
Element.Description: The name of the city where the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country in which the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message. Organization number for norwegian parties

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone name
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact fax name
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Electronic address ID
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the receiving party electronic address. The address can be of any format and the format should be identified in the message. Organization number for norwegian parties

Element.Name: Party identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Element.Name: Party name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party identifier.

Element.Name: Kjøpers referanse
Element.Description: Name or identifier specifying the customers reference (Eg employee number)

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone name
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact fax name
Element.Description: A fax number for the contact persons.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: General payment conditions
Element.Description: Description of general payment conditions.

Element.Name: Line identifier
Element.Description: Each line must have an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to positively reference the line. For example, from other documents.

Element.Name: Line action code
Element.Description: Used to instruct the catalogue receier on what action should be taken on the identified line when revising a catalogue. See rule on catalogue version ID. When using Update or Delete codes, the entire Catalogue Line is updated or deleted. Legal values: Add, Update, Delete. If Update or Delete are used, this applies to the enitre catalogue line.

Element.Name: Contract subdivision
Element.Description: Reference to subsection of contract

Element.Name: Orderable indicator
Element.Description: Default value is True i.e. Item on the Catalogue Line can be ordered. Can be used to indicate if an Item is temporarily out of stock (via a Catalogue Update).

Element.Name: Orderable indicator
Element.Description: The unit in which the item described in this catalogue line can be ordered. The same item can be described in more than one catalogue line with different orderble units. E.g. catalogue line 1 describes item X that can be ordered in boxes at a given price. Line 2 may describe the same item X as orderable in pallets where the price is lower.

Element.Name: Item net quantity
Element.Description: The net quantity of the item that is contained in each consumable unit, excluding any packaging materials.

Element.Name: Order quantity increment
Element.Description: The increment of Orderable units that can be ordered. Default vaule = 1. If orderable unit is box, and order quantity increment is set to 6, this product can only be ordered in 6, 12, 18 etc boxes.

Element.Name: Minimum order quantity
Element.Description: The minimum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line, such as price.

Element.Name: Maximum order quantity
Element.Description: The maximum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line, such as price.

Element.Name: Line warranty information
Element.Description: Warranty information that applies to the catalogue line item.

Element.Name: Packing level
Element.Description: The packing level of the catalogue line.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period. Format: YYYY-MM-DD

Element.Name: Standardized unit price
Element.Description: The item price based on a standarized unit. E.g. Price of each liter. See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Standardized unit quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of standard units that are in each consumable unit. E.g. if consumable units are bottles and each bottle contains 0,333 liters the standard unit quantity is 0,333 See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Attribute.Name: Standard unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The standard unit of measure used to enable comparison of item price to other items. See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Attribute.Name: Packed units
Attribute.Description: The prepacking the article is available in inside the orderable unit (next lower level packing), and which contains the number of unit described in PackSizeNumeric. Unit desciption to PackQuantity. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like CS for case.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Element.Name: Price lead time
Element.Description: The order lead time for the particular location.

Element.Name: Quantity threshold
Element.Description: Minimum quantity for the given price.

Element.Name: Quantity ceiling
Element.Description: Max quantity for the given price.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post Code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: The country where the address is. The country should always be given by using ISO code 3166 alpha 2.

Element.Name: Item net price
Element.Description: The price for the item at the specified locations. The price is given for each orderable unit.

Element.Name: Base quantity
Element.Description: The number of quantity units for which the price is stated.

Element.Name: Price type
Element.Description: The type of the price so that the receiver knows if the price may be changed, is indicative. When prices are temporary the validity period for the price should be defined by stating the price validity period.

Element.Name: Orderable unit factor rate
Element.Description: The factor used to convert the Base Quantity to an Orderable Unit. Must be specified if the Orderable Unit differs from the Base Quantity. If not present, assumed value is 1.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: A detailed description of the item. Use one description pr. language
Element.Value: Adhesive Loctite 480 20 g. Black rubber enforced adhesive for gluing of metal to metal or metal to rubber. Especially suitable for applications where the joining is put under cleavage or chock stress. Go to http://www.yoursite.com/pagename.html target=_blank for tips on general usage of this product.

Element.Name: Pack quantity
Element.Description: The number of packed units that are in the orderable unit. E.g. if the orderable unit is a pallet that contains 30 boxes then the packed units are BOX and the packed quantity is 30.

Element.Name: Consumable unit quantity
Element.Description: Specifies the number of consumable units that are in each orderable unit. See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: A short name for an item. Item name should be a unique name that clearly identifies the product.

Element.Name: Item key words
Element.Description: Used to specify searchable keywords and/or synonyms for the Item. E.g. Item Name = Colgate or Total / Keyword =Toothpaste Note that key words should not be too generic, and words allready existing in item name or item description should not be repeated in the key words. If more than one key word is used in the same element, we recommend to use "%" as separator, but this should be agreed with the recipient of the catalogue.

Element.Name: Brand name
Element.Description: Brand name for the product.

Element.Name: Seller item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the item. A product must be identified with either the sellers item identifier or the standard item identifier, or both.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identifier
Element.Description: The manufacturers identifier for the item.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: A item identifier based on a registered schema. A product must be identified with either the sellers item identifier or the standard item identifier, or both.

Element.Name: Attachment ID
Element.Description: A positive identification of the relevant document, such as an unique identifier..

Element.Name: External item specifications type
Element.Description: Code for document type

Element.Name: Attachment description
Element.Description: A short description of the document type

Element.Name: Attached object
Element.Description: The attached document embedded as binary object.

Element.Name: URI
Element.Description: URI reference to external item information or specifications. E.g. web address

Element.Name: Item origin country
Element.Description: Used to provide the country from which the item has it's origin. Commonly used in cross border trade for statistical and customs purposes. Based on ISO 3166-1.

Element.Name: Item classification code
Element.Description: A classification code used to classify the type or nature of the Item. More than one classifications can be used including UNSPSC code and CPV code.

Element.Name: Transaction conditions identifier
Element.Description: When ActionCode = CT, the product is under contract.

Element.Name: Contracted item indicator
Element.Description: Indicates that an the item is offered in accordance to an existing contract.

Element.Name: Hazardous UNDG code
Element.Description: Provides detail of the classification and nature of a hazardous item. A link to a HMS safety sheet must be provided if there is a hazardous item.

Element.Name: Hazard class identifier
Element.Description: Provides detail of the classification and nature of a hazardous item.

Element.Name: Item VAT category code
Element.Description: The VAT code that indicates what VAT details apply to the item.

Element.Name: Item VAT percentage
Element.Description: The VAT percentage rate that applies to the item unless specific trade reasons apply such as exemptions.

Element.Name: Tax scheme ID
Element.Description: Tax Scheme ID =VAT

Element.Name: Property name
Element.Description: The name of the property. The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant. E.g. Size, Color, Year.

Element.Name: Property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property. E.g. XXL, Blue, 2007.

Element.Name: Property unit of measure
Element.Description: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.

Element.Name: Property classification
Element.Description: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.

Element.Name: Manufacturer party name
Element.Description: The name of the manufacturer of the item.

Element.Name: Item best before date
Element.Description: Used to express the best before date of the item or items in the line instance.

Element.Name: Item batch identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the production batch that the item(s) listed in the catalogue line were part of.

Element.Name: Label name
Element.Description: The name of the product label.

Element.Name: Certificate type code
Element.Description: The code type for the label.

Element.Name: Certificate type
Element.Description: The label type such environmental, quality, social etc.

Element.Name: Label value
Element.Description: The label value that applies to the item.

Element.Name: Issuer name
Element.Description: Name of Label issuer.

Element.Name: Label reference
Element.Description: A reference to where the label specification can be found, e.g. a URI.

Element.Name: Dimension ID
Element.Description: Possible values: Weight, Height, Length, Width, Minimum Storage Temperature, Maximum Storage Temperature.

Element.Name: Measure (height, length, width, weight)
Element.Description: The vertical height of the orderable unit. The horizontal measure of the longer site of the orderable unit. The horizontal measure of the shorter side of the orderable unit. The weight of the orderable unit incuding its packaging.

Element.Name: Minimum storage temperature
Element.Description: The lower margin of the recommended storage temerature range for the item.

Element.Name: Maximum storage temperature
Element.Description: The upper margin of the recommended storage temerature range for the item.
